bibl.title: Letter from William C. Gorgas to Mabel H. Lazear, April 4, 1903

div1.p: Gorgas requests Mabel Lazear's opinion on raising a subscription for her benefit. He reports that Emilie Lawrence Reed was just granted a pension. He expresses his admiration for Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from William C. Gorgas to Mabel H. Lazear, April 4, 1903

opener.dateline:
No. 117 East 54th St. N.Y. City.
April 4th 1903.

div1.p:
I have recently gotten a letter
from Dr. Wyeth of New York suggesting
that if agreeable to you a subscription
be gotten up for your benefit. He asked
me to find out what your wishes were
on the subject. He also asked me to
find out what your present income was,
how many children & what their ages &
what your present pension.

During this last session of Congress
Mrs. Reed was granted a pension of
fifteen hundred per anum.

I was thrown very intimately with
Dr. Lazear in Cuba, & formed the highest
opinion of him in every way. I saw him nearly
every day while he was sick & he always talked
to me very freely about his work & aspirations.

If I can be of any service it would afford me
a great deal of pleasure. Please accept my
assurances of Kindest regards & believe me
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, W.C. Gorgas.
Major Colonel Medical Corps.
U.S. Army. Address
Surgeon General's Office
Washington D.C.
